name: Asilomar Conference Grounds

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Asilomar Conference Center through an academic conference. The rooms were tiny, overpriced and dirty. The staff were rude to us throughout our stay. The only positive was the nice beach and view; but there are many close beach areas nearby that don't require staying at this terrible resort.
reviews.title: Asilomar - Worse Conference Center On West Coast
Rustic beauty~ lodging not a hotel.
reviews.text: If you are planning a conference I say that places like Granlibakken in Lake Tahoe are at least 10X better for value and accommodations.

Room was functional, staff's favorite answer seemed to be "that's how we do it here". The views were wonderful, as an exhibitor for a conference it was an awful venue. If you want a rustic room in a wooded setting this is it, if you want a hotel like experience stay somewhere else. The meals were good, the service average to poor, timing was a bit tricky one hour for lunch and dinner two hours for breakfast, the times conflicted with the conference exhibit hours. No TV in the room was a nice rustic touch, pool tables and board games in the main lodge, a few in our cabin too. I would stay here again, not as an exhibitor for a conference.
reviews.title: Family atmosphere made conference bearable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed for three nights for a long conference, in the oldest bunkhouse called The Lodge, 1917, upgraded buildings. Well worth every penny-no TV, small beds but very comfortable-iron frames!! fully functional, modern sink and bathroom-stair climbing and hiking ability needed in this building unless staying downstairs. Fully ADA facility-in evenings, Hearst Social Hall has a roaring fire and good conversation is the rule. Partiers also abound here-CA State Park denizens and open entry so many from town walk dogs and come to supper here. It is two miles all the way around to the beach if not walking the boardwalk-do not do this because there is no room on the shoulder, you vs. the cars: stay on grounds to go to beach. Brrr, cold in Fall even with the heated pool. Bring your jackets and sweaters.Good food & hosts.
reviews.title: room needs help / grounds worth it

reviews.text: Like most reviews we had a room that was not historical but modern according to booking desk at hotel. The room was dated like a cheap motel and the walls thin. We did not have a view except for another building.
reviews.title: Peaceful Perfection

reviews.text: Asilomar is a unique property, it is a former Y conference center and much of their patronage is for conference business, with some rooms for individuals. The center is rustic being in a State Park, and close to the ocean it is a great place to relax.
reviews.title: Good location, walking distance to beach

reviews.text: The size of the conference center means that many rooms are a good walk from the dining room and the beach, which is across the road.
reviews.title: Stay anywhere else but here !!!

reviews.text: The breakfast room is set up with large round tables, the food was institutional (mainly muffins, cereal and hard boiled eggs), but no one is coming here for the food.
reviews.title: Exellent location, Room depends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To say that this place is ramshackle is paying a compliment. It's VERY rustic. I understand that it was meant to be. However,my room there was hideous ! Stained carpet, drapes off the runner, wall paper torn, bolt marks in the wall where something was hung.....the food in the dining hall is hit or miss. I did not see any other rooms in other buildings. Perhaps they are better. The beach is right there & they have a decent swimming pool. As for the room, I honestly considered sleeping in my clothes.
reviews.title: If you need a place to lay your head its not so bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are hundreds of places to stay in this area. Don't stay here.
reviews.title: Ambience

reviews.text: My family and I have gone to asilomar each year for the past several years. The biggest downside is the price. These are conference style hotel rooms. The facilities and beds are nothing to write home about, and compared to the other hotels available at the same price, they are a bit underwhelming.
reviews.title: Longtime Visitor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That being said, the location is ideal. It is the best location, and grounds in Pacific Grove. Most of the hotels are smaller, and farther from the beach. Asilomar has a trail that goes right to the beach, and the grounds are extensive. There are always animals out and about, and many of the rooms have sliding glass doors, so you can watch them go by.
reviews.title: Rustic & Historical Accommendations

reviews.text: The service is professional, and accommodating. We always ended up swithing rooms around, and they were great about it. My husband and I like the fireplace rooms, on the ground floor so you can watch animals, my brother and his wife prefer the rooms without fireplaces, because they have asthma. My mom prefers the historic room, because of their character.
reviews.title: Adequate Room; Great Grounds

reviews.text: It is a great place, and there are different types of accommodation for different people, but you definitely pay the price.
reviews.title: Beautiful nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an opportunity to stay at Asilomar Conference Ground, a State of California Park the weekend of September 15th & 16th, 2012. Room was a one bedroom, one bath with a view located in the Long View North building.
reviews.title: Not a $200 hotel, rooms with balconies, ocean views, new carpets

reviews.text: Going to a conference or a wedding here, enjoy the place during the day, the ocean, the meeting rooms, the atmosphere. Sleep somewhere else at night. We made the mistake of actually staying in one of the rooms. Large room with 4 beds (we were only 2 people) - none comfortable. No TV, radio, refrigerator, microwave, counter in the sink, or coffeemaker. Noisy heater circa 1950s. Shower that took several minutes to finally get water at the right temperature. Not sure what was crawling in the carpet. Wall so thin you could hear someone next door sigh. Motel 6 would be a huge upgrade compared to this place. Yes, of course we paid almost $200 a night for the pleasure, why do you ask? The final straw was the inattentive staff. Made reservations 2 months in advance (it was a wedding) and asked for a room right next to another couple in the wedding party. Ignored. Got there before 3:30 pm and were told that they do not absolutely check anyone in before 3:30. Several other examples available and I can go on and on but you get the point.
reviews.title: Sleep somewhere else

reviews.text: We were told about the $99 vouchers by a friend but failed to check here first. Please read the "terrible" reviews before you book as they are very accurate and date back to 2006. When we spoke to the front desk about the room conditions after checking in, we were told that they were "in the middle of renovations, please come back soon and try us again". NEVER GOING TO HAPPEN! Apparently they have been handing out this line for sometime. Don't miss out on visiting Monterey just because of this place. Go, but stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: PLEASE read the terrible reviews before you book!

reviews.text: First came here about 20 years ago, to see the Julia Morgan architecture. Fabulous, as are the buildings not by her, but in her style. Back in those days it was much cheaper, and prices have gone up a lot, but still within our price range - just.
reviews.title: Tranquil conference center by the sea set in beautiful grounds and peaceful architecture.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tall ceilings in some of the bedrooms are magnificent. Really elegant buildings. Amused by review that complains this place is not a hotel. Of course it is not! Asimolar is a conference center, and a national historic landmark.
reviews.title: It works for a certain type of traveler

reviews.text: Breakfast in the Crocker dining room is an added bonus. What other 'hotel' treats you to breakfast in such a magnificent Julia Morgan dining hall?
reviews.title: Needs a facelift and a good scrubbing!

aka: Asilomar Conference Grounds Hotel Pacific Grove
